intro: Microtis media, commonly known as the common microtis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Microtis media is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
